=Using the !FileBrowser with TinyMCE=

You can also replace the TinyMCE Image/File Manager with the !FileBrowser.
What you have to do is a !FileBrowser Callback. ThereÂ´s an example in /media/js/ called tinymceAdmin.js - you can copy the !FileBrowserCallback to your own file or take a look at http://www.rorlach.de/mediawiki/index.php/Custom_filebrowser.

To use the !FileBrowser with TinyMCE, just add these lines to your model:
{{{
js = (
    'filebrowser/js/AddFileBrowser.js',
    'tinymce/jscripts/tiny_mce/tiny_mce.js',
    'js/custom/tinymce_admin.js',
)
}}}

Hint: the script tiny_mce_popup.js is going to overwrite some Django CSS. In order to avoid this, just make a copy of tiny_mce_popup.js (e.g. tiny_mce_popup_fb.js) and delete line 80:
{{{
document.write('<link href="' + tinyMCE.getParam("popups_css") + '" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css">');
}}}
The template index.html already points to tiny_mce_popup_fb.js - you may want to change that line (line 24 of index.html), otherwise you get the error "TinyMCE is not defined":
{{{
<script language="javascript" type="text/javascript" src="{% admin_media_prefix %}tinymce/jscripts/tiny_mce/tiny_mce_popup_fb.js"></script>
}}}
